result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Defendant will not request early termination of Probation.
------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 10-18-2022  Pursuant to Letter from DOC and Order of the Court, Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect count #2 with Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer severity to Felony U.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
--------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
--------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with the victim.
--------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
--------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
--------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to serve two (2) weeks in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before November 4, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: The defendant is to report to jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of work release privileges for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court.

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Herman E Smith in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Herman E Smith.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Lettenberger reserves jurisdictional objection. Waiting on information from Small Claims action.
Victim in court, no statement made.

adj. 3:03PM
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 4/8/2022 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH S.N.H. (dob 10/5/1974) OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM S.N.H. (dob 10/5/1974). Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
